page.title: 12Folklore
page.content: Myth surrounds the stone circles. It is said that the "Great Ting"- or general parliament of Shetland met at one of the circles in Unst before being removed to Tingwall.Anyone found "guilty" by the Foude(judge) and udallers had the right of appeal to the voice of the people. The accused then had to run to the most westerly circle of stones. If he reached the circle in safety ,his life was preserved,but if popular opinion was against him,he was pursued and anyone might put him to death before reaching the sanctuary. Another tale suggests that witches were burned alive at the Rounds of Tivla. These witches were usually elderly spinsters blamed for inexplicable tragedies-such as still-born calves or the sudden death of an animal.
